timeline.author: donraab

timeline.bodyText: Similar to the other pull request that was pulling up default methods, I would prefer to remove only purely structural code.
timeline.author: donraab

timeline.bodyText: Similar to the comment above. This is the more standard pattern for implementing unmodifiable behavior.
timeline.author: donraab

replies.bodyText:
Catching up on your other comments, I take the point about it being more difficult to perform the code review when I remove methods, and it requires reasoning about whether that's ok. I have to point out that this is not that much of a standard pattern for implementing unmodifiable behavior. I just tried going into UnmodifiableMutableMap and pressing Cmd+I (to implement, not override) and I see many methods implemented that are otherwise not implemented using this pattern.

flatCollectWith
flatCollectWith (target)
countBy
countBy(target)
countByWith
countByWith(target)
countByEach
countByEach(target)
forEach(Procedure)
forEach(Consumer)
getAny
minOptional()
maxOptional()
minOptional(Comparator)
maxOptional(Comparator)
minByOptional
maxByOptional
summarizeInt
summarizeFloat
summarizeLong
summarizeDouble
reduceInPlace(Collector)
reduceInPlace(Supplier, BiConsumer)
reduce
groupByAndCollect
replies.author: motlin
donraab

replies.bodyText: Yes, I plan on pulling all those up and more. I started with a few "easy" methods to see how it goes.
replies.author: motlin

replies.bodyText: Ok, I think I can get comfortable with the unmodifiable moves here.
replies.author: donraab

timeline.bodyText: Same as the other unmodifiable comment above.
timeline.author: donraab
